result.execSummary:
The defendant Baug Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO, including but not limited to SAFE programming.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Baug Vang

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:13am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Battery/DA/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE
State also notes agreement of parties that State will not file charges regarding other specific alleged criminal activity within a specific time frame.

PLEA:
Ct. 2 (DC/DA/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO, including but not limited to SAFE programming; CC including one domestic abuse surcharge; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena served on S.M.R. 6/23/15)

Keep JT on

Jury Trial on July 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for Adjournment-GRANTED

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:22am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Kat Jackan

Motion hearing set for today with JT set for 5/12/15; COURT notes receipt of Request for Adjournment of the JT filed by State.
COURT addresses matter of adjournment of trial - Argument by State and by Attorney Jackan; COURT Grants Request to Adjourn JT set for 5/12 - parties to reset matter for one day JT as soon as possible.

COURT now addresses Motions in Limine filed by both parties.
State has no objections to defense MIL; Atty Jackan states no objection to State's MIL.

COURT Addresses 12 Defense MIL>>
State agrees with all 12 - COURT Grants all 12 subparts.

COURT addresses State's MIL>>
COURT grants 1-5 as Atty Jackan agrees to such; As to #6, COURT questions if there are any Miranda/Goodchild issues - Atty Jackan notes there are not; COURT advises counsel to remind court to take address matter in #7 the morning before trial.

COURT addresses State's impeachment MIL; Arguments by counsel as to prior convictions should defendant testify - COURT makes rulings and number of prior convictions for purpose of impeachment if defendant testifies will be 6.
Bond continues, and COURT reminds parties to reset JT date.

Adj: 9:33am

COURT questions victim re: request to allow contact - victim makes statement and requests no contact be lifted.
Argument by State against modification of bond condition.

COURT lifts the no contact but changes condition to "No violent or abusive contact with victim."

Kathryn Jackan

No contact with victim(s): S.R. (NON-WAIVEABLE).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings (Mosinee PD).  3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
